details.purpose: For recording the results of visual field testing or perimetry.
details.use:
To record the results of visual field testing or perimetry.
The 'Clinical Description' data element can be used to record simple narrative summary or as a means to integrate legacy data.
Detailed, structured visual acuity results are preferred and are generally recorded for each eye in turn.
details.misuse: Where the perimetry method or device changes between each eye, a new record Entry should be created at runtime.

items.items: Results of visual field testing / perimetry.
A term, commonly coded, expressing an overall interpretation of the visual field test.
A multimedia representaion of the visual field test.
Details of the visual field test result for each eye.
The eye which is being examined.
The test result expressed as a qualitative term, normally coded.
The method used to record the perimetry result.
Goldman perimetry was used to measure the visual fields.
The Dicon device was used to measure the visual fields.
A Henson device was used to measure the visual fields.
An Octopus device was used to measure the visual fields.
A Humphrey device was used to measure the visual fields.
Frequency Doubling Perimetry was used to measure the visual fields.
Patient circumstances which may affect interpretation of the result.
Any additional narrative comment about the visual field test.
A term, commonly coded, expressing an overall interpretation of the visual field test.
Details of the device used to measure visual fields.
A coded intepretation of the Glaucoma Hemifield Test (GHT).

Differences between a matched pair of corresponding zones exceeds the difference found in 99% of the normal population, or when both members of a pair of zones are more abnormal than 99.5% of the individuals with the normative population.
Matched pairs of zones are abnormal at the 97th percentile within the normative database.
Conditions for âoutside normal limitsâ are not met, and the best region of the visual field is at or below the 99.5th percentile of the normative population.
Overall sensitivity in the affected region of the VF is better than 99.5% of individuals within the normative population.
None of the abnormal conditions are met.
The average of deviation in vusual field across all test areas.
Average of non-uniform visual field loss.
Details of refractive correction applied to each eye.
The P value of the Mean Deviation result.
The P value of the Pattern Standard deviation result.
FASTPAC automated standard perimetry was used to measure the visual fields.
